Institutions

Career Profile

I am a Research Scholar (Doctoral Fellow) in Computer Science at Computer Vision Center, Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona, Barcelona, Spain. A enthusiastic programmer and a ML/VISION reasearcher. I am a researcher in Computer Vision, Pattern Recognition, Machine Learning and related fields. Currently, I am a PhD. student, under the supervision of Dr. Josep Lladós and Prof. Dr. Umapada Pal. My main research interest includes computer vision, pattern recognition and image processing. In particular, I work with multi-modal data embedding in common sub space, structural pattern recognition, and apply them for various applications such as natural language processing, sketch based image retrieval, object detection, recognition etc.

Development of stand-alone compact data logger. Study, Design and Guiding Bachelor’s Intern Student.

Research Trainee

Variable Energy Cyclotron Center, Atomic Energy of India, India

Study, design and develop instrumentation for measurement of magnetic susceptibilty. Observed Frequency-adapted crossover from para-to-dia magnetization in an Ising-like dipole-dipole a model

  • Finite Element Analysis

Projects

Side projects I was associated with during my PhD.

Consolidated Research Group DAG-CVC (SGR) - AGAUR funded project for Image Processing, Pattern Reconition and Computer Vision related problems
Contextual Recognition of Ancient Documents (Co-Read) - MINECO funded project Contextual Recognition of Ancient Documents (Co-READ) studies information spotting techniques to search words and shapes in ancient document images. In addition, contextual search in documents will be investigated. Context means the structural and syntactic relations between basic components (words and symbols)
CONtextualising the COntents in the Recognition of Document Images from Archives (CONCORDIA) - MINECO funded project CONCORDIA aims to make a qualitative leap forward in the interpretation of historical documents with the incorporation of context and knowledge from the experts through advanced human interfaces
